answers.answer: IT ALL DEPENDS ON WHAT THEY SAY I GUESS... BUT IT SOUNDS LIKE THEY ARE ON THE SOC. SEC. SIDE.  I FOUGHT AND FOUGHT WITH THESE PEOPLE AND IT REALLY GETS AGGRAVATING BUT DONT GIVE UP ... KEEP FIGHTING THEM ..I FINALLY WON MINE LAST JUNE AND STARTED RECIEVING MY BENEFITS IN AUGUST 08.
Did you have to go to the SS Drs. before you got approved or did you get a denial? If so how many times did they turn you down? Thanks for answering my question.

IT WAS JUNE O5 WHEN I DECIDED I COULDNT WORK NO MORE AND I IMMEDIATELY SIGNED UP FOR DISABILITY... IT TOOK ALMOST 6 MONTHS FOR THEM TO DENY ME FOR THE FIRST TIME.  I THEN WENT AND GOT A LAWYER AND WE REAPPLIED AND WITHIN A FEW MONTHS OR SO I WAS DENIED AGAIN. THEN I WAS ABLE TO REQUEST FOR A HEARING TO GO IN FRONT OF THE JUDGE AND THEN HE WOULD DECIDE IT I WAS TO RECIEVE MY DISABILITY OR NOT ... WHICH HE APPROVED ME. BUT IT TOOK 3 YEARS TO DO ALL OF THAT. THE HEARING IS WHAT TOOK THE LONGEST.  HERE IN OHIO THEY ARE SO BACKED UP BECAUSE OF SO MANY PEOPLE APPLYING THAT I HAD TO HAVE A JUDGE COME FROM SOUTH CAROLINA AND WE MET IN PARKERSBURG , WVA.'I HAD TO GO TO A SOC. SEC. DOCTOR THE 2ND. TIME I APPLIED.. AND LIKE I SAID I GOT DENIED AND HE WAS THE FIRST DOCTOR THAT TOLD ME THAT I HAVE FIBROMYALGIA..FIGURE THAT ONE.,  BUT AFTER THAT I STARTED HAVING ALLOT OF OTHER PROBLEMS ANDBY THE TIME MY HEARING CAMEUP I WAS ON HEAVY PAIN MEDICATION AND HAVE CONG. HEART FAILURE, COPD, DIABETES, CFS, RESTLESS LEG SYNDROME, SWELLING CLEAR UP TO MY STOMACH, DEPRESSION AND THE LIST GOES ON I WAS EVEN IN RIVERSIDE HOSPITAL IN COLUMBUS OHIO WITH PULM. EMBL. I HAD SEVERAL CLOTS THAT WENT TO MY LUNGS  4 OF THEM TO BE EXACT.  THANK GOD THAT IM STILL HERE.  SOC. SEC IS VERY HARD TO GET. BUT U MUST  KEEP TRYING.  WELL IF YOUR LIKE ME I HAD NO CHOICE I KNEW I COULDNT GO BACK TO WORK SO I HAD NOTHING ELSE TO DO BUT FIGHT FOR IT,GOOD LUCK AND I HOPE U GET IT
